subject: RE: [junit] Identify name of the TestCase
msgSnippet: I wanted a list of all the test cases I ve run so I made a listener (and did some other probably not very kosher tactics). I can email it to you personally if
messageBody:
I wanted a list of all the test cases I've run so I made a listener (and did
some other probably not very kosher tactics).

I can email it to you personally if you'd like maybe you could come up with
something better :-).


-----Original Message-----
From: Gupta, Vipul [mailto:Vipul.Gupta@...]
Sent: Monday, April 14, 2003 07:56 AM
To: 'JUnit'
Subject: [junit] Identify name of the TestCase


Hi Friends,

Need help in identifying the name of the test case in jUnit.

I am running some tests through the Suite in jUnit and from the TestResult
I
want to know the name of the (TestCase)testFunction that was executed. Do
we
have anything like this available in jUnit from which we can identify the
TestCase which is being run in the suite.

TestResult t= new TestResult();
t = junit.textui.TestRunner.run(tc.doTest());

Any advice will be highly appreciated.

Regards

Vipul Gupta
Software Development Engineer - QA
Barco | Control Rooms
India
